content.rendered: Jake Clemons joined the E Street Band for the Wrecking Ball Tour in 2012. In Born to Run, Bruce Springsteen writes that “Jake had E Street soul in his blood and bones,” and in his decade-long tenure, he has pulled off the balancing act of carrying on his uncle Clarence Clemons’ legacy while establishing himself as his own musician. He played on the Wrecking Ball, High Hopes, and The River tours, and he appears on the albums High Hopes and Letter to You.

yoast_head_json.title: Jake Clemons | Bruce Springsteen
yoast_head_json.description: Jake Clemons joined the E Street Band for the Wrecking Ball Tour in 2012. In Born to Run, Bruce Springsteen writes that “Jake had E Street soul in his blood and bones,” and in his decade-long tenure, he has pulled off the balancing act of carrying on his uncle Clarence Clemons' legacy while establishing himself as his own musician. He played on the Wrecking Ball, High Hopes, and The River tours, and he appears on the albums High Hopes and Letter to You.

He played on the Wrecking Ball, High Hopes, and The River tours, and he appears on the albums High Hopes and Letter to You.
